proxmox.defaults.lxc.description: Default values inheritible by all LXC containers.

proxmox.defaults.lxc.arch.description: Sets the container OS architecture type.

proxmox.defaults.lxc.clone.type: null or integer between 100 and 2147483647 (both inclusive)

proxmox.defaults.lxc.cmode.description:
Configures console mode.
"tty" tries to open a connection to one of the available tty devices.
"console" tries to attach to /dev/console instead.
"shell" simply invokes a shell inside the container (no login).

proxmox.defaults.lxc.cores.description:
The number of cores assigned to the container.
A container can use all available cores by default.

proxmox.defaults.lxc.cpulimit.description: A number to limit CPU usage by.

proxmox.defaults.lxc.cpuunits.description: A number of the CPU weight that the container possesses.

proxmox.defaults.lxc.features.description: An object for allowing the container to access advanced features.

proxmox.defaults.lxc.features.fuse.description: A boolean for enabling FUSE mounts.

proxmox.defaults.lxc.features.keyctl.description: A boolean for enabling the `keyctl()` system call.

proxmox.defaults.lxc.features.mknod.description:
Allow unprivileged containers to use mknod() to add certain device nodes.
This requires a kernel with seccomp trap to user space support (5.3 or newer).
This is experimental.

proxmox.defaults.lxc.features.mount.description: Defines the filesystem types (separated by semicolons) that are allowed to be mounted.

proxmox.defaults.lxc.features.nesting.description: A boolean to allow nested virtualization.

proxmox.defaults.lxc.flake.description:
Flake to use for deploying NixOS configuration changes via https://github.com/numtide/terraform-deploy-nixos-flakes
Use null to skip attempting to deploy NixOS configuration changes.

proxmox.defaults.lxc.force.description: A boolean that allows the overwriting of pre-existing containers.

proxmox.defaults.lxc.full.description:
When cloning, create a full copy of all disks.
This is always done when you clone a normal CT.
For CT template it creates a linked clone by default.

proxmox.defaults.lxc.hookscript.description:
A string containing a volume identifier to a script that
will be executed during various steps throughout the container's lifetime.
The script must be an executable file.

proxmox.defaults.lxc.memory.description: A number containing the amount of RAM to assign to the container (in MB).

proxmox.defaults.lxc.nameserver.description:
The DNS server IP address used by the container. 
If neither nameserver nor searchdomain are specified, 
the values of the Proxmox host will be used by default.

proxmox.defaults.lxc.onboot.description: Whether to start the container on boot.

proxmox.defaults.lxc.ostemplate.description: The volume identifier that points to the OS template or backup file.

proxmox.defaults.lxc.password.description:
Sets the root password inside the container.
Doesn't seem to work with NixOS containers.

proxmox.defaults.lxc.pool.description: The name of the Proxmox resource pool to add this container to.

proxmox.defaults.lxc.protection.description:
A boolean that enables the protection flag on this container. 
Stops the container and its disk from being removed/updated. 
Default is false.

proxmox.defaults.lxc.rootfs.size.description:
Size of the underlying volume.
Must end in G, M, or K (e.g. "1G", "1024M" , "1048576K").
Cannot be changed after initial creation.

proxmox.defaults.lxc.rootfs.storage.description:
A string containing the volume , directory, or device to be
mounted into the container (at the path specified by mp).
E.g. local-lvm, local-zfs, local etc.

proxmox.defaults.lxc.ssh_public_keys.description: The name of the Proxmox resource pool to add this container to.

proxmox.defaults.lxc.start.description: A boolean that determines if the container is started after creation.

proxmox.defaults.lxc.startup.description: The startup and shutdown behaviour of the container.

proxmox.defaults.lxc.swap.description: A number that sets the amount of swap memory available to the container.

proxmox.defaults.lxc.tags.description: Tags of the container. This is only meta information.

proxmox.defaults.lxc.target_node.description: The name of the Proxmox Node on which to place the VM

proxmox.defaults.lxc.unique.description: Whether a unique random ethernet address is assigned to the container.

proxmox.defaults.lxc.unprivileged.description: A boolean that makes the container run as an unprivileged user.

proxmox.defaults.qemu.description: Default values inheritable by all Qemu VMs.

proxmox.defaults.qemu.agent.description:
Wether to enable the QEMU Guest Agent.
Note: you must run the qemu-guest-agent daemon in the guest for this to have any effect.

proxmox.defaults.qemu.balloon.description:
The minimum amount of memory to allocate to the VM in MB.
See https://pve.proxmox.com/pve-docs/chapter-qm.html#qm_memory for documentation.

proxmox.defaults.qemu.boot.description:
The boot order for the VM. Ordered string of characters denoting boot order.
Options: floppy (a), hard disk (c), CD-ROM (d), or network (n).

proxmox.defaults.qemu.clone.description:
The base VM from which to clone to create the new VM.
Note: clone is mutually exclussive with pxe and iso

proxmox.defaults.qemu.cores.description: The number of CPU cores per socket to allocate to the VM

proxmox.defaults.qemu.flake.description:
Flake to use for deploying NixOS configuration changes via https://github.com/numtide/terraform-deploy-nixos-flakes
Use null to skip attempting to deploy NixOS configuration changes.

proxmox.defaults.qemu.full_clone.description:
Wether to perform a full clone.
See https://pve.proxmox.com/pve-docs/chapter-qm.html#qm_copy_and_clone for documentation

proxmox.defaults.qemu.iso.description:
The name of the ISO image to mount to the VM.
Only applies when clone is not set.
Note: iso is mutually exclussive with clone and pxe

proxmox.defaults.qemu.memory.description: The amount of memory to alloate to the VM in MB

proxmox.defaults.qemu.numa.description:
Non-Uniform Memory Access
See https://pve.proxmox.com/pve-docs/chapter-qm.html#_numa for documentation

proxmox.defaults.qemu.onboot.description: Whether to start this VM on PVE startup

proxmox.defaults.qemu.os_type.description: Which provisioning method to use, based on the OS type.

proxmox.defaults.qemu.pool.description: The resource pool to which the VM will be added

proxmox.defaults.qemu.pxe.description:
PXE boot of the VM. Requires network be set first in boot
Note: pxe is mutually exclussive with clone and iso

proxmox.defaults.qemu.scsihw.description: The SCSI controller type to be used

proxmox.defaults.qemu.sockets.description: The number of CPU sockets to allocate to the VM

proxmox.defaults.qemu.sshkeys.description: SSH public keys to add to authorized keys file for cloud-init user

proxmox.defaults.qemu.tags.description: Tags of the VM. This is only meta information.

proxmox.defaults.qemu.target_node.description: The name of the Proxmox Node on which to place the VM

proxmox.enable.description:
Whether to enable proxmox provider
See https://registry.terraform.io/providers/Telmate/proxmox for documentation
.

proxmox.lxc.<name>.arch.description: Sets the container OS architecture type.

proxmox.lxc.<name>.clone.type: null or integer between 100 and 2147483647 (both inclusive)

proxmox.lxc.<name>.cmode.description:
Configures console mode.
"tty" tries to open a connection to one of the available tty devices.
"console" tries to attach to /dev/console instead.
"shell" simply invokes a shell inside the container (no login).

proxmox.lxc.<name>.cores.description:
The number of cores assigned to the container.
A container can use all available cores by default.

proxmox.lxc.<name>.cpulimit.description: A number to limit CPU usage by.

proxmox.lxc.<name>.cpuunits.description: A number of the CPU weight that the container possesses.

proxmox.lxc.<name>.enable.description: Whether to enable deploying this container.

proxmox.lxc.<name>.features.description: An object for allowing the container to access advanced features.

proxmox.lxc.<name>.features.fuse.description: A boolean for enabling FUSE mounts.

proxmox.lxc.<name>.features.keyctl.description: A boolean for enabling the `keyctl()` system call.

proxmox.lxc.<name>.features.mknod.description:
Allow unprivileged containers to use mknod() to add certain device nodes.
This requires a kernel with seccomp trap to user space support (5.3 or newer).
This is experimental.

proxmox.lxc.<name>.features.mount.description: Defines the filesystem types (separated by semicolons) that are allowed to be mounted.

proxmox.lxc.<name>.features.nesting.description: A boolean to allow nested virtualization.

proxmox.lxc.<name>.flake.description:
Flake to use for deploying NixOS configuration changes via https://github.com/numtide/terraform-deploy-nixos-flakes
Use null to skip attempting to deploy NixOS configuration changes.

proxmox.lxc.<name>.force.description: A boolean that allows the overwriting of pre-existing containers.

proxmox.lxc.<name>.full.description:
When cloning, create a full copy of all disks.
This is always done when you clone a normal CT.
For CT template it creates a linked clone by default.

proxmox.lxc.<name>.hookscript.description:
A string containing a volume identifier to a script that
will be executed during various steps throughout the container's lifetime.
The script must be an executable file.

proxmox.lxc.<name>.hostname.description: Specifies the host name of the container.

proxmox.lxc.<name>.memory.description: A number containing the amount of RAM to assign to the container (in MB).

proxmox.lxc.<name>.mountpoint.description: An attribute set describing the mount points present in this container

proxmox.lxc.<name>.mountpoint.<name>.bac.description: Wether to enable including this mount point in backups

proxmox.lxc.<name>.mountpoint.<name>.mp.description:
The path to the mount point as seen from inside the container. 
The path must not contain symlinks for security reasons.

proxmox.lxc.<name>.mountpoint.<name>.quo.description: Wether to enable user quotas inside the container for this mount point

proxmox.lxc.<name>.mountpoint.<name>.rep.description: Wether to enable including this volume in a storage replica job

proxmox.lxc.<name>.mountpoint.<name>.sha.description: Wether to enable marking this volume as available to all nodes

proxmox.lxc.<name>.mountpoint.<name>.siz.description:
Size of the underlying volume.
Must end in G, M, or K (e.g. "1G", "1024M" , "1048576K").
Cannot be changed after initial creation.

proxmox.lxc.<name>.mountpoint.<name>.sto.description:
A string containing the volume , directory, or device to be mounted
into the container (at the path specified by mp).

proxmox.lxc.<name>.name.description: Name to use when creating terraform resources

proxmox.lxc.<name>.nameserver.description:
The DNS server IP address used by the container. 
If neither nameserver nor searchdomain are specified, 
the values of the Proxmox host will be used by default.

proxmox.lxc.<name>.network.description: An attribute set describing the network adapters present in this container

proxmox.lxc.<name>.network.<name>.bridge.description: Bridge to which the network device should be attached

proxmox.lxc.<name>.network.<name>.firewa.description: Whether to enable the Proxmox firewall on this network device.

proxmox.lxc.<name>.network.<name>.hwaddr.description: Override the randomly generated MAC Address for the container

proxmox.lxc.<name>.network.<name>.ip.description:
The IPv4 address of the network interface. 
Can be a static IPv4 address (in CIDR notation), "dhcp", or "manual".

proxmox.lxc.<name>.network.<name>.ip6.description:
The IPv6 address of the network interface. 
Can be a static IPv6 address (in CIDR notation), "auto", "dhcp", or "manual".

proxmox.lxc.<name>.network.<name>.name.description: The name of the network interface as seen from inside the container.

proxmox.lxc.<name>.network.<name>.tag.description: The VLAN tag to apply to packets on this device

proxmox.lxc.<name>.onboot.description: Whether to start the container on boot.

proxmox.lxc.<name>.ostemplate.description: The volume identifier that points to the OS template or backup file.

proxmox.lxc.<name>.password.description:
Sets the root password inside the container.
Doesn't seem to work with NixOS containers.

proxmox.lxc.<name>.pool.description: The name of the Proxmox resource pool to add this container to.

proxmox.lxc.<name>.protection.description:
A boolean that enables the protection flag on this container. 
Stops the container and its disk from being removed/updated. 
Default is false.

proxmox.lxc.<name>.rootfs.size.description:
Size of the underlying volume.
Must end in G, M, or K (e.g. "1G", "1024M" , "1048576K").
Cannot be changed after initial creation.

proxmox.lxc.<name>.rootfs.storage.description:
A string containing the volume , directory, or device to be
mounted into the container (at the path specified by mp).
E.g. local-lvm, local-zfs, local etc.

proxmox.lxc.<name>.ssh_public_keys.description: The name of the Proxmox resource pool to add this container to.

proxmox.lxc.<name>.start.description: A boolean that determines if the container is started after creation.

proxmox.lxc.<name>.startup.description: The startup and shutdown behaviour of the container.

proxmox.lxc.<name>.swap.description: A number that sets the amount of swap memory available to the container.

proxmox.lxc.<name>.tags.description: Tags of the container. This is only meta information.

proxmox.lxc.<name>.target_node.description: The name of the Proxmox Node on which to place the VM

proxmox.lxc.<name>.unique.description: Whether a unique random ethernet address is assigned to the container.

proxmox.lxc.<name>.unprivileged.description: A boolean that makes the container run as an unprivileged user.

proxmox.lxc.<name>.vmid.description: VMID to assign this container or `null` for next available ID
proxmox.lxc.<name>.vmid.type: null or integer between 100 and 2147483647 (both inclusive)

proxmox.provider.log_level.description:
Log level to use for proxmox provider or null to disable logging.

Logs will be written to terraform-plugin-proxmox.log. This may be 
overriden with provider.proxmox.pm_log_file

proxmox.provider.password.description:
Proxmox password for API user authentication.
May be also be provied through PM_PASSWORD environment variable

proxmox.provider.token_id.description:
Proxmox token id for API token authentication.
May be also be provied through PM_AP_TOKEN_ID environment variable

proxmox.provider.token_secret.description:
Proxmox token secret for API token authentication.
May be also be provied through PM_AP_TOKEN_SECRET environment variable

proxmox.provider.user.description:
Proxmox user for API user authentication.
May be also be provied through PM_USER environment variable

proxmox.provider.version.description: Version of the telmate/proxmox provider to use

proxmox.qemu.<name>.agent.description:
Wether to enable the QEMU Guest Agent.
Note: you must run the qemu-guest-agent daemon in the guest for this to have any effect.

proxmox.qemu.<name>.balloon.description:
The minimum amount of memory to allocate to the VM in MB.
See https://pve.proxmox.com/pve-docs/chapter-qm.html#qm_memory for documentation.

proxmox.qemu.<name>.boot.description:
The boot order for the VM. Ordered string of characters denoting boot order.
Options: floppy (a), hard disk (c), CD-ROM (d), or network (n).

proxmox.qemu.<name>.clone.description:
The base VM from which to clone to create the new VM.
Note: clone is mutually exclussive with pxe and iso

proxmox.qemu.<name>.cores.description: The number of CPU cores per socket to allocate to the VM

proxmox.qemu.<name>.desc.description: The description of the VM. Shows as the 'Notes' field in the Proxmox GUI.

proxmox.qemu.<name>.disk.description: Disks to attach to this VM

proxmox.qemu.<name>.disk.*.discard.description:
Controls whether to pass discard/trim requests to the underlying storage
Not supported for `efidisk`

proxmox.qemu.<name>.disk.*.size.description: The size of the created disk

proxmox.qemu.<name>.disk.*.ssd.description:
Whether to enable SSD emulation on disk
Not supported for `efidisk`

proxmox.qemu.<name>.disk.*.storage.description: he name of the storage pool on which to store the disk

proxmox.qemu.<name>.disk.*.type.description: The type of disk device to add

proxmox.qemu.<name>.domain.description: Domain used for generate FQDN for provisioning

proxmox.qemu.<name>.enable.description: Whether to enable deploying this VM.

proxmox.qemu.<name>.flake.description:
Flake to use for deploying NixOS configuration changes via https://github.com/numtide/terraform-deploy-nixos-flakes
Use null to skip attempting to deploy NixOS configuration changes.

proxmox.qemu.<name>.full_clone.description:
Wether to perform a full clone.
See https://pve.proxmox.com/pve-docs/chapter-qm.html#qm_copy_and_clone for documentation

proxmox.qemu.<name>.iso.description:
The name of the ISO image to mount to the VM.
Only applies when clone is not set.
Note: iso is mutually exclussive with clone and pxe

proxmox.qemu.<name>.memory.description: The amount of memory to alloate to the VM in MB

proxmox.qemu.<name>.network.description: Network devices to attach to this VM

proxmox.qemu.<name>.network.*.bridge.description: Bridge to which the network device should be attached

proxmox.qemu.<name>.network.*.firewall.description: Whether to enable the Proxmox firewall on this network device.

proxmox.qemu.<name>.network.*.macaddr.description: Override the randomly generated MAC Address for the VM

proxmox.qemu.<name>.network.*.model.description:
Network Card Model.
The virtio model provides the best performance with very low CPU overhead.
If your guest does not support this driver, it is usually best to use e1000.

proxmox.qemu.<name>.network.*.tag.description: The VLAN tag to apply to packets on this device

proxmox.qemu.<name>.numa.description:
Non-Uniform Memory Access
See https://pve.proxmox.com/pve-docs/chapter-qm.html#_numa for documentation

proxmox.qemu.<name>.onboot.description: Whether to start this VM on PVE startup

proxmox.qemu.<name>.os_type.description: Which provisioning method to use, based on the OS type.

proxmox.qemu.<name>.pool.description: The resource pool to which the VM will be added

proxmox.qemu.<name>.pxe.description:
PXE boot of the VM. Requires network be set first in boot
Note: pxe is mutually exclussive with clone and iso

proxmox.qemu.<name>.scsihw.description: The SCSI controller type to be used

proxmox.qemu.<name>.sockets.description: The number of CPU sockets to allocate to the VM

proxmox.qemu.<name>.sshkeys.description: SSH public keys to add to authorized keys file for cloud-init user

proxmox.qemu.<name>.tags.description: Tags of the VM. This is only meta information.

proxmox.qemu.<name>.target_node.description: The name of the Proxmox Node on which to place the VM

proxmox.qemu.<name>.vmid.description: VMID to use for creation or `null` to auto-assign the next available ID
proxmox.qemu.<name>.vmid.type: null or integer between 100 and 2147483647 (both inclusive)

proxmox.show_deploy_output.description:
Whether to enable showing output from nixos_deploy
      May include sensitive information
.
